intro: Oxypetalum oblongifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf oxypetalum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are elongated and narrow, giving it its common name. Oxypetalum oblongifolium is often found in moist, well-drained soils and can thrive in shaded to partially shaded environments.
